the same time as the City. Of the three Imperial Abbeys in Regensburg,

'Regensburg' (; historically also 'Ratisbon', from Celtic Ratisbona, ) is a
city in Bavaria, Germany, located at the confluence of the Danube and Regen
rivers, at one of the northernmost points of the Danube. To the east lies the
Bavarian Forest. Regensburg is the capital of the Bavarian administrative
region Upper Palatinate. The large medieval centre of the city is a UNESCO
World Heritage Site.
categories: Displaced persons camps in the aftermath of World War II
